// pages/index.js
import { useState } from "react";
import Head from "next/head";
import Link from "next/link";
import AuditModal from "../components/AuditModal";

const SITE_URL = process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SITE_URL || "https://your-project.vercel.app";
const OG_IMAGE = `${SITE_URL}/Services-BG-1.jpg`;

export default function Home() {
  const [open, setOpen] = useState(false);

  return (
    <>
      <Head>
        <meta charSet="utf-8" />
        <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width,initial-scale=1" />

        <title>Soarix ‚Äì Digital Growth Agency</title>
        <meta
          name="description"
          content="We help startups & SMEs with websites, branding, and campaigns that actually move the needle."
        />
        <meta
          name="keywords"
          content="digital marketing, website development, branding, SEO, growth"
        />

        {/* Canonical */}
        <link rel="canonical" href={SITE_URL + "/"} />

        {/* OpenGraph */}
        <meta property="og:title" content="Soarix ‚Äì Digital Growth Agency" />
        <meta
          property="og:description"
          content="Websites, branding, and campaigns that convert."
        />
        <meta property="og:image" content={OG_IMAGE} />
        <meta property="og:url" content={SITE_URL + "/"} />
        <meta property="og:type" content="website" />

        {/* Twitter */}
        <meta name="twitter:card" content="summary_large_image" />
        <meta name="twitter:title" content="Soarix ‚Äì Digital Growth Agency" />
        <meta
          name="twitter:description"
          content="Websites, branding, and campaigns that convert."
        />
        <meta name="twitter:image" content={OG_IMAGE} />

        {/* Theme & favicon (replace favicon path if you have one) */}
        <meta name="theme-color" content="#0b6bff" />
        <link rel="icon" href="/favicon.ico" />

        {/* JSON-LD Organization (update fields) */}
        <script
          type="application/ld+json"
          dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{
            __html: JSON.stringify({
              "@context": "https://schema.org",
              "@type": "Organization",
              "name": "Soarix",
              "url": SITE_URL,
              "logo": SITE_URL + "/logo.png",
              "sameAs": [
                "https://www.facebook.com/yourpage",
                "https://www.linkedin.com/company/yourcompany"
              ]
            })
          }}
        />
      </Head>

      {/* HERO */}
      <section
        className="hero"
        style={{ position: "relative", height: "100vh", overflow: "hidden" }}
        aria-label="Hero section"
      >
        <video
          autoPlay
          muted
          loop
          playsInline
          preload="metadata"
          style={{
            position: "absolute",
            top: 0,
            left: 0,
            width: "100%",
            height: "100%",
            objectFit: "cover",
            zIndex: 0,
            pointerEvents: "none",
          }}
        >
          <source
            src="https://acvmcgpbiiskbnvoxfbc.supabase.co/storage/v1/object/public/Soarix-bg/soarix-bg.mp4"
            type="video/mp4"
          />
          Your browser does not support the video tag.
        </video>

        <div className="container" style={{ position: "relative", zIndex: 2 }}>
          <h1>Accelerate. Amplify. Automate.</h1>
          <div className="sub">AI-Powered Growth for SMEs, Startups & Product Brands</div>
          <div className="hero-cta">
            <button className="btn primary" onClick={() => setOpen(true)}>
              Book for Audit
            </button>
          </div>
        </div>
      </section>

      {/* QUOTE */}
      <div className="quote">
        From brand strategy to digital campaigns, Soarix helps businesses grow faster with AI-powered solutions.
      </div>

      {/* SERVICES */}
      <section className="services container" aria-labelledby="services-title">
        <h2 id="services-title" className="services-title">Our Services</h2>

        <div className="grid">
          <article className="card">
            <h4>Brand Identity &amp; Strategy</h4>
            <p>Logos, guidelines, positioning &amp; storytelling ‚Äî we build distinct brands that connect and drive value.</p>
          </article>

          <article className="card">
            <h4>Website Development</h4>
            <p>SEO optimized, scalable, and secure web platforms. Fast, accessible, and designed to convert.</p>
          </article>

          <article className="card">
            <h4>Digital Campaigns</h4>
            <p>Google Ads, Meta Ads, influencer &amp; performance marketing campaigns tuned to your KPIs.</p>
          </article>

          <article className="card">
            <h4>AI-Powered Growth</h4>
            <p>Analytics, reporting, automation, and optimization ‚Äî we combine human creativity with AI to scale growth.</p>
          </article>
        </div>

        <div className="services-cta">
          <Link href="/services" legacyBehavior>
            <a className="btn-cta">Explore More Services</a>
          </Link>
        </div>

        <div className="cta-panel">
          <strong>Ready to grow?</strong>
          <p>Book a free growth audit and we'll send a tailored plan for your business.</p>
          <button className="btn primary" onClick={() => setOpen(true)}>Book an Audit</button>
        </div>
      </section>

      {open && <AuditModal open={open} onClose={() => setOpen(false)} />}

      <style jsx>{`
        .services-cta {
          margin-top: 20px;
          text-align: center;
        }
        .btn-cta {
          background: var(--accent, #0b6bff);
          color: #fff;
          border: 0;
          padding: 12px 20px;
          border-radius: 10px;
          cursor: pointer;
          font-weight: 600;
          box-shadow: 0 8px 20px rgba(11, 107, 255, 0.2);
          transition: all 0.2s ease;
          display: inline-block;
          text-decoration: none;
        }
        .btn-cta:hover {
          background: #084dcc;
          transform: translateY(-2px);
        }

        /* small helpers */
        .container { max-width: 1100px; margin: 0 auto; padding: 40px 16px; }
        .grid { display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit,minmax(220px,1fr)); gap: 20px; }
        .card { background:#fff; border-radius:12px; padding:20px; box-shadow:0 6px 20px rgba(16,24,40,0.06); }
        .hero .container { display:flex; flex-direction:column; justify-content:center; height:100%; align-items:flex-start; color:#fff; }
        .quote { text-align:center; padding:24px; font-size:16px; color:#333; }
        .cta-panel { margin-top:28px; text-align:center; padding:20px; border-radius:10px; background:linear-gradient(90deg,#f7fbff,#fff); }
      `}</style>
    </>
  );
}

ChatGPT said:
The image shows the hero heading perfectly centered ‚Äî so the fix is purely CSS. Right now your .hero .container uses align-items: flex-start (or no centering), which makes the content sit left/top. Replace that with centering rules and a few small tweaks so the text stays centered on all screen sizes.

Paste this CSS into your pages/index.js (inside the existing <style jsx>{``}</style>) or into your global CSS file. It will center the hero content both vertically and horizontally, keep the video as background, and make the CTA visible and accessible.

/* HERO: centered overlay */
.hero {
  position: relative;
  height: 100vh;
  overflow: hidden;
  display: block;
}

.hero video {
  position: absolute;
  inset: 0;                 /* top:0; right:0; bottom:0; left:0 */
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  object-fit: cover;
  z-index: 0;
  pointer-events: none;
}

/* Center the content both vertically and horizontally */
.hero .container {
  position: relative;
  z-index: 2;
  max-width: 1200px;
  margin: 0 auto;
  height: 100%;
  display: flex;
  flex-direction: column;
  justify-content: center; /* vertical centering */
  align-items: center;     /* horizontal centering */
  text-align: center;      /* center text inside the container */
  padding: 0 20px;         /* small horizontal padding for mobile */
  color: #fff;
}

/* Large hero heading */
.hero h1 {
  margin: 0 0 12px;
  font-size: clamp(32px, 6vw, 64px); /* responsive size */
  line-height: 1.05;
  font-weight: 800;
  text-shadow: 0 6px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.55); /* improves contrast on video */
}

/* Subtitle */
.hero .sub {
  font-size: clamp(14px, 2.2vw, 20px);
  margin-bottom: 20px;
  opacity: 0.95;
}

/* CTA wrapper */
.hero .hero-cta {
  margin-top: 6px;
}

/* Primary button: keep it visible over the video */
.btn.primary {
  background: linear-gradient(180deg, #0b6bff, #0860d6);
  color: white;
  border: 0;
  padding: 12px 18px;
  border-radius: 10px;
  cursor: pointer;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 30px rgba(11,107,255,0.18);
  font-weight: 700;
}

/* If you need left-aligned text on wide screens: use a utility class */
.hero .container.left-align {
  align-items: flex-start;
  text-align: left;
  padding-left: 64px;
}

/* Mobile tweaks */
@media (max-width: 640px) {
  .hero h1 { font-size: 28px; }
  .hero .container { padding: 0 16px; }
}
How to apply:

If you used the Home code I gave earlier, find the <style jsx>{...}</style> block and replace or merge the .hero .container and .hero h1 styles with the CSS above.

Save and push ‚Üí Vercel will redeploy and you‚Äôll see the heading centered again.

If you intentionally want the heading left-aligned on desktop but centered on mobile, add the left-align class to the container conditionally (or in markup):

<div className="container left-align" style={{ position: "relative", zIndex: 2 }}>
  ...
</div>
Then override with the media query so mobile still centers. (Or remove the left-align class to keep everything centered.)

<style jsx>{`
  .grid { display: grid; grid-template-columns: repeat(auto-fit,minmax(240px,1fr)); gap: 28px; }

  .card {
    background: #fff;
    border-radius: 12px;
    padding: 0;             /* moved padding into card-body */
    box-shadow: 0 6px 20px rgba(16,24,40,0.06);
    transition: transform 240ms cubic-bezier(.2,.9,.2,1), box-shadow 240ms ease, filter 240ms ease;
    will-change: transform;
    cursor: pointer;
    outline: none;
    border: 1px solid rgba(16,24,40,0.03);
  }

  .card:focus { box-shadow: 0 10px 30px rgba(11,107,255,0.14); transform: translateY(-6px) scale(1.015); }
  .card:hover,
  .card:focus,
  .card:focus-within {
    transform: translateY(-10px) scale(1.03); /* pop + lift */
    box-shadow: 0 18px 40px rgba(16,24,40,0.14);
  }

  /* small 'pop' micro-animation on hover start */
  @keyframes pop {
    0% { transform: translateY(0) scale(1); }
    60% { transform: translateY(-12px) scale(1.034); }
    100% { transform: translateY(-10px) scale(1.03); }
  }
  .card:hover { animation: pop 260ms cubic-bezier(.2,.9,.2,1) both; }

  .card-body {
    padding: 22px;
    border-radius: 12px;
    position: relative;
    overflow: hidden;
  }

  .card h4 {
    margin: 0 0 10px;
    font-size: 16px;
    font-weight: 800;
    color: #0b2133;
  }
  .card p {
    margin: 0;
    color: #4b5563;
    line-height: 1.55;
    font-size: 14px;
  }

  /* Arrow style (initially hidden, slides in on hover) */
  .arrow {
    position: absolute;
    right: 18px;
    bottom: 18px;
    font-size: 20px;
    line-height: 1;
    color: var(--accent, #0b6bff);
    opacity: 0;
    transform: translateX(-10px) scale(0.98);
    transition: transform 300ms cubic-bezier(.2,.9,.2,1), opacity 200ms ease;
    pointer-events: none;
  }

  /* On hover/focus make arrow visible with slide-in + tiny wiggle */
  .card:hover .arrow,
  .card:focus .arrow,
  .card:focus-within .arrow {
    opacity: 1;
    transform: translateX(0) scale(1);
    animation: arrowPulse 900ms ease-in-out infinite 300ms;
  }

  @keyframes arrowPulse {
    0% { transform: translateX(0) translateY(0) scale(1); }
    50% { transform: translateX(3px) translateY(-1px) scale(1.02); }
    100% { transform: translateX(0) translateY(0) scale(1); }
  }

  /* Make arrow disappear on small screens (optional) */
  @media (max-width: 640px) {
    .arrow { display: none; }
    .card { border-radius: 10px; }
  }
`}</style>

Arrow color uses --accent CSS variable; tum global me :root { --accent: #0b6bff; } rakho to change brand color easily.

Performance: animations are transform/opacity-only ‚Äî GPU-accelerated and fast.

          box-shadow: 0 12px 36px rgba(11, 107, 255, 0.14);

        .btn-ghost {
          background: transparent;
          color: #fff;
          border: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.16);
          padding: 10px 14px;
          border-radius: 10px;
          text-decoration: none;
          font-weight: 600;
        }

        /* Main container */
        .container {
          max-width: var(--maxW);
          margin: 28px auto;
          padding: 0 20px;
        }

        /* Cards list */
        .cards {
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          gap: 18px;
          margin-top: 6px;
        }

        /* Card */
        .card {
          position: relative;
          overflow: visible;
          border-radius: var(--radius);
          padding: 20px;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          background: transparent;
        }
        .card-layer {
          position: absolute;
          inset: 6px;
          border-radius: calc(var(--radius) - 2px);
          background: var(--card);
          box-shadow: 0 18px 48px rgba(6, 10, 18, 0.06);
          border: 1px solid rgba(10, 12, 18, 0.04);
          z-index: 0;
          pointer-events: none;
        }

        .card-grid {
          position: relative;
          z-index: 1;
          display: grid;
          grid-template-columns: 80px 1fr;
          gap: 20px;
          align-items: start;
        }

        .card-icon {
          display: flex;
          align-items: flex-start;
        }
        .icon-box {
          width: 80px;
          height: 80px;
          border-radius: 12px;
          display: flex;
          align-items: center;
          justify-content: center;
          background: linear-gradient(180deg, #fff, #fbfbfb);
          border: 1px solid rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.04);
          box-shadow: 0 10px 30px rgba(11, 107, 255, 0.06);
        }

        .card-content {
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          gap: 12px;
        }
        .card-headline {
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          gap: 8px;
        }
        .tag {
          color: var(--muted);
          font-weight: 700;
          font-size: 12px;
          text-transform: uppercase;
          letter-spacing: 0.06em;
        }
        .card-title {
          margin: 0;
          font-size: 18px;
          font-weight: 800;
          color: #0b2130;
        }
        .card-desc {
          margin: 0;
          color: #475569;
          font-size: 14px;
          line-height: 1.55;
        }

        .outcome-grid {
          margin-top: 6px;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          gap: 8px;
        }
        .outcome-grid .row {
          display: grid;
          grid-template-columns: 160px 1fr;
          gap: 12px;
          align-items: start;
        }
        .outcome-grid dt {
          font-weight: 700;
          color: var(--muted);
          font-size: 13px;
        }
        .outcome-grid dd {
          margin: 0;
          color: #111827;
          line-height: 1.6;
          font-size: 14px;
        }
        .time-note {
          margin-top: 8px;
          color: #6b7280;
          font-size: 13px;
          line-height: 1.45;
          /* subtle accent for timeframe note */
        }

        .deliverables {
          margin-top: 10px;
          color: #0b2130;
        }
        .deliverables strong {
          display: block;
          margin-bottom: 6px;
          color: var(--muted);
          font-size: 13px;
          font-weight: 700;
        }
        .deliverables ul {
          margin: 0;
          padding-left: 18px;
        }
        .deliverables li {
          margin-bottom: 6px;
          color: #374151;
          font-size: 14px;
          line-height: 1.5;
        }

        .card-actions {
          display: flex;
          justify-content: flex-end;
          margin-top: 8px;
        }
        .btn-cta {
          background: linear-gradient(180deg, var(--accent), #0a5ce6);
          color: #fff;
          padding: 10px 16px;
          border-radius: 10px;
          text-decoration: none;
          font-weight: 800;
          display: inline-block;
          box-shadow: 0 12px 36px rgba(11, 107, 255, 0.12);
        }

        /* BUILD / MINI GRID - restored background & motion (rounded) */
        .build {
          margin-top: 28px;
        }
        .muted {
          color: #64748b;
          margin-top: 6px;
        }
        .mini-grid {
          display: grid;
          grid-template-columns: repeat(3, 1fr);
          gap: 16px;
          margin-top: 12px;
        }

        .mini {
          position: relative;
          border-radius: 14px; /* rounded outer */
          overflow: hidden;
          min-height: 160px;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          background: var(--card); /* white background */
          box-shadow: 0 8px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.05);
          transition: transform 0.28s ease, box-shadow 0.28s ease;
        }
        .mini-bg {
          position: absolute;
          inset: 0;
          background-size: cover;
          background-position: center;
          opacity: 0.08;
          filter: contrast(0.95) saturate(0.9);
          border-radius: 14px; /* ensure bg also rounded */
          transition: transform 0.32s ease, opacity 0.32s ease;
        }
        .mini-content {
          position: relative;
          z-index: 2;
          padding: 18px;
          border-radius: 14px; /* rounded inner */
          background: linear-gradient(180deg, rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.95), rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.96));
          width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          justify-content: space-between;
          gap: 12px;
          box-shadow: inset 0 -8px 24px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.02);
        }
        .mini h4 {
          margin: 0;
          font-size: 16px;
        }
        .mini p {
          margin: 0;
          color: #475569;
          font-size: 13.5px;
          line-height: 1.5;
        }

        .btn-outline {
          display: inline-block;
          padding: 8px 12px;
          border-radius: 8px;
          border: 1px solid rgba(11, 107, 255, 0.12);
          color: var(--accent);
          text-decoration: none;
          font-weight: 700;
        }

        /* hover effect for mini cards */
        .mini:hover {
          transform: translateY(-6px);
          box-shadow: 0 14px 32px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.08);
        }
        .mini:hover .mini-bg {
          transform: scale(1.04);
          opacity: 0.12;
        }
        .mini:hover .mini-content {
          box-shadow: 0 18px 42px rgba(6, 10, 18, 0.06);
          transform: translateY(-6px);
          transition: transform 0.28s ease;
        }

        /* How we work */
        .how {
          margin-top: 28px;
        }
        .steps {
          display: grid;
          grid-template-columns: repeat(3, 1fr);
          gap: 12px;
          margin-top: 12px;
        }
        .step {
          background: var(--card);
          padding: 14px;
          border-radius: 12px;
          box-shadow: 0 8px 26px rgba(6, 10, 18, 0.04);
          border: 1px solid rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.03);
        }
        .step strong {
          display: block;
          margin-bottom: 6px;
        }

        /* CTA area */
        .cta {
          margin-top: 28px;
          background: linear-gradient(180deg, var(--accent), #0a5ce6);
          border-radius: 12px;

        .cta-inner {
          max-width: var(--maxW);
          margin: 0 auto;
          display: flex;
          align-items: center;
          justify-content: space-between;
          gap: 12px;
        }
        .cta-copy h4 {
          margin: 0 0 6px;
        }
        .btn-primary.large {
          padding: 12px 20px;
          border-radius: 12px;
          font-size: 16px;
        }

        /* Responsive */
        @media (max-width: 980px) {
          .card-grid {
            grid-template-columns: 64px 1fr;
            gap: 16px;
          }
          .icon-box {
            width: 64px;
            height: 64px;
          }
          .outcome-grid .row {
            grid-template-columns: 140px 1fr;
          }
          .mini-grid {
            grid-template-columns: repeat(2, 1fr);
          }
          .hero-ctas { flex-direction: column; gap: 10px; }
          .hero-ctas .btn-primary { width: 100%; text-align: center; }
        }
        @media (max-width: 780px) {
          .hero {
            padding: 36px 16px;
          }
          .title {
            font-size: 24px;
          }
          .container {
            padding: 0 16px;
          }
          .card-grid {
            grid-template-columns: 1fr;
          }
          .card-icon {
            order: 0;
            display: flex;
            justify-content: flex-start;
          }
          .card-actions {
            justify-content: flex-start;
          }
          .mini-grid {
            grid-template-columns: 1fr;
          }
          .steps {
            grid-template-columns: 1fr;
          }
          .outcome-grid .row {
            grid-template-columns: 1fr;
          }
        }

        /* accessibility focus */
        a:focus,
        button:focus {
          outline: 3px solid rgba(11, 107, 255, 0.18);
          outline-offset: 2px;
        }

            --accent-foreground: #ffffff;
            --card: #09090b;
            --card-foreground: #ffffff;
            --popover: #09090b;
            --popover-foreground: #ffffff;
            --radius: 0.5rem;
        }

        body {
            font-family: 'Inter', -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, sans-serif;
            background-color: var(--background);
            color: var(--foreground);
            line-height: 1.5;
            font-weight: 400;
            font-size: 16px;
        }

        .container {
            width: 100%;
            max-width: 1200px;
            margin: 0 auto;
            padding: 0 24px;
        }

        /* Hero Section */
        .hero {
            padding: 80px 0 48px;
            text-align: center;
        }

        .hero h1 {
            font-size: 48px;
            font-weight: 700;
            line-height: 1.2;
            letter-spacing: -0.02em;
            margin-bottom: 16px;
            background: linear-gradient(135deg, #ffffff 0%, #8b5cf6 100%);
            -webkit-background-clip: text;
            -webkit-text-fill-color: transparent;
            background-clip: text;
        }

        .hero p {
            font-size: 20px;
            font-weight: 400;
            line-height: 1.6;
            color: var(--muted-foreground);
            max-width: 600px;
            margin: 0 auto;
        }

        /* Contact Grid */
        .contact-grid {
            display: grid;
            grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr;
            gap: 48px;
            padding: 48px 0 80px;
        }

        @media (max-width: 768px) {
            .contact-grid {
                grid-template-columns: 1fr;
                gap: 32px;
            }
            
            .hero h1 {
                font-size: 36px;
            }
            
            .hero p {
                font-size: 18px;
            }
        }

        /* Contact Info */
        .contact-info h2 {
            font-size: 32px;
            font-weight: 600;
            line-height: 1.25;
            letter-spacing: -0.02em;
            margin-bottom: 32px;
            color: var(--foreground);
        }

        .info-item {
            display: flex;
            align-items: flex-start;
            gap: 16px;
            margin-bottom: 24px;
        }

        .info-icon {
            width: 48px;
            height: 48px;
            border-radius: 12px;
            background: linear-gradient(135deg, var(--accent) 0%, #a78bfa 100%);
            display: flex;
            align-items: center;
            justify-content: center;
            flex-shrink: 0;
        }

        .info-icon svg {
            width: 20px;
            height: 20px;
            color: white;
        }

        .info-content h3 {
            font-size: 18px;
            font-weight: 600;
            line-height: 1.4;
            margin-bottom: 4px;
            color: var(--foreground);
        }

        .info-content p {
            font-size: 16px;
            font-weight: 400;
            line-height: 1.6;
            color: var(--muted-foreground);
        }

        /* Contact Form */
        .contact-form h2 {
            font-size: 32px;
            font-weight: 600;
            line-height: 1.25;
            letter-spacing: -0.02em;
            margin-bottom: 32px;
            color: var(--foreground);
        }

        .form-group {
            margin-bottom: 24px;
        }

        .form-group label {
            display: block;
            margin-bottom: 8px;
            font-size: 16px;
            font-weight: 500;
            line-height: 1.5;
            color: var(--foreground);
        }

        .form-control {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 16px;
            background: var(--card);
            border: 1px solid var(--border);
            border-radius: 8px;
            color: var(--foreground);
            font-size: 16px;
            font-weight: 400;
            line-height: 1.5;
            transition: border-color 0.2s ease;
        }

        .form-control:focus {
            outline: none;
            border-color: var(--accent);
        }

        textarea.form-control {
            min-height: 140px;
            resize: vertical;
        }

        .submit-btn {
            background: linear-gradient(135deg, var(--accent) 0%, #a78bfa 100%);
            color: var(--accent-foreground);
            border: none;
            padding: 16px 32px;
            border-radius: 8px;
            font-size: 16px;
            font-weight: 600;
            line-height: 1.5;
            cursor: pointer;
            transition: transform 0.2s ease, box-shadow 0.2s ease;
        }

        .submit-btn:hover {
            transform: translateY(-2px);
            box-shadow: 0 8px 24px rgba(139, 92, 246, 0.3);
        }

        /* Indian Context */
        .indian-context {
            background: rgba(139, 92, 246, 0.05);
            border-radius: 12px;
            padding: 24px;
            margin-top: 24px;
            border-left: 2px solid var(--accent);
        }

        .indian-context h3 {
            font-size: 18px;
            font-weight: 600;
            line-height: 1.4;
            color: var(--accent);
            margin-bottom: 8px;
            display: flex;
            align-items: center;
            gap: 8px;
        }

        .indian-context p {
            font-size: 16px;
            font-weight: 400;
            line-height: 1.6;
            color: var(--muted-foreground);
        }

        /* SVG Icons */
        .svg-icon {
            width: 20px;
            height: 20px;
            fill: currentColor;
        }
    </style>
</head>

            const email = document.getElementById('email').value;
            const phone = document.getElementById('phone').value;
            const subject = document.getElementById('subject').value;
            const message = document.getElementById('message').value;
            
            // Simple validation
            if (!name || !email || !subject || !message) {
                alert('Please fill in all required fields.');
                return;
            }
            
            // In a real application, you would send this data to your server
            // For demo purposes, we'll just show a success message
            alert('Thank you for your message! We will get back to you soon.');
            this.reset();
        });

        // Phone number formatting for Indian numbers
        document.getElementById('phone').addEventListener('input', function(e) {
            let value = e.target.value.replace(/\D/g, '');
            
            // Ensure it starts with 91 for Indian numbers
            if (value && !value.startsWith('91')) {
                value = '91' + value;
            }
            
            // Format as +91 XXXXX XXXXX
            if (value.length > 2) {
                value = '+' + value.substring(0, 2) + ' ' + 
                       value.substring(2, 7) + ' ' + 
                       value.substring(7, 12);
            } else if (value.length === 2) {
                value = '+' + value;
            }
            
            e.target.value = value.substring(0, 16); // Limit to +91 XXXXX XXXXX format
        });
    </script>

            background-color: var(--background);
            color: var(--foreground);
            line-height: 1.5;
            font-weight: 400;
            font-size: 16px;
        }

        .container {
            width: 100%;
            max-width: 1200px;
            margin: 0 auto;
            padding: 0 24px;
        }

        /* Hero Section */
        .hero {
            padding: 80px 0 48px;
            text-align: center;
        }

        .hero h1 {
            font-size: 48px;
            font-weight: 700;
            line-height: 1.2;
            letter-spacing: -0.02em;
            margin-bottom: 16px;
            background: linear-gradient(135deg, #1e293b 0%, #3b82f6 100%);
            -webkit-background-clip: text;
            -webkit-text-fill-color: transparent;
            background-clip: text;
        }

        .hero p {
            font-size: 20px;
            font-weight: 400;
            line-height: 1.6;
            color: var(--muted-foreground);
            max-width: 600px;
            margin: 0 auto;
        }

        /* Contact Grid */
        .contact-grid {
            display: grid;
            grid-template-columns: 1fr 1fr;
            gap: 48px;
            padding: 48px 0 80px;
        }

        @media (max-width: 768px) {
            .contact-grid {
                grid-template-columns: 1fr;
                gap: 32px;
            }
            
            .hero h1 {
                font-size: 36px;
            }
            
            .hero p {
                font-size: 18px;
            }
        }

        /* Contact Info */
        .contact-info h2 {
            font-size: 32px;
            font-weight: 600;
            line-height: 1.25;
            letter-spacing: -0.02em;
            margin-bottom: 32px;
            color: var(--foreground);
        }

        .info-item {
            display: flex;
            align-items: flex-start;
            gap: 16px;
            margin-bottom: 24px;
        }

        .info-icon {
            width: 48px;
            height: 48px;
            border-radius: 12px;
            background: linear-gradient(135deg, var(--accent) 0%, #60a5fa 100%);
            display: flex;
            align-items: center;
            justify-content: center;
            flex-shrink: 0;
        }

        .info-icon svg {
            width: 20px;
            height: 20px;
            color: white;
        }

        .info-content h3 {
            font-size: 18px;
            font-weight: 600;
            line-height: 1.4;
            margin-bottom: 4px;
            color: var(--foreground);
        }

        .info-content p {
            font-size: 16px;
            font-weight: 400;
            line-height: 1.6;
            color: var(--muted-foreground);
        }

        /* Contact Form */
        .contact-form h2 {
            font-size: 32px;
            font-weight: 600;
            line-height: 1.25;
            letter-spacing: -0.02em;
            margin-bottom: 32px;
            color: var(--foreground);
        }

        .form-group {
            margin-bottom: 24px;
        }

        .form-group label {
            display: block;
            margin-bottom: 8px;
            font-size: 16px;
            font-weight: 500;
            line-height: 1.5;
            color: var(--foreground);
        }

        .form-control {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 16px;
            background: var(--card);
            border: 1px solid var(--border);
            border-radius: 8px;
            color: var(--foreground);
            font-size: 16px;
            font-weight: 400;
            line-height: 1.5;
            transition: border-color 0.2s ease;
        }

        .form-control:focus {
            outline: none;
            border-color: var(--accent);
            box-shadow: 0 0 0 3px rgba(59, 130, 246, 0.1);
        }

        textarea.form-control {
            min-height: 140px;
            resize: vertical;
        }

        .submit-btn {
            background: linear-gradient(135deg, var(--accent) 0%, #60a5fa 100%);
            color: var(--accent-foreground);
            border: none;
            padding: 16px 32px;
            border-radius: 8px;
            font-size: 16px;
            font-weight: 600;
            line-height: 1.5;
            cursor: pointer;
            transition: transform 0.2s ease, box-shadow 0.2s ease;
        }

        .submit-btn:hover {
            transform: translateY(-2px);
            box-shadow: 0 8px 24px rgba(59, 130, 246, 0.3);
        }

        /* Indian Context */
        .indian-context {
            background: rgba(59, 130, 246, 0.05);
            border-radius: 12px;

        }

        .indian-context p {
            font-size: 16px;
            font-weight: 400;
            line-height: 1.6;
            color: var(--muted-foreground);
        }

        /* SVG Icons */
        .svg-icon {
            width: 20px;
            height: 20px;
            fill: currentColor;
        }
    </style>

// pages/contact.js
import Head from "next/head";

  const phoneRef = useRef(null);

  function formatIndianPhone(e) {
    let value = e.target.value.replace(/\D/g, "");
    if (value && !value.startsWith("91")) value = "91" + value;
    if (value.length > 2) {
      value = "+" + value.substring(0, 2) + " " + value.substring(2, 7) + " " + value.substring(7, 12);
    } else if (value.length === 2) {
      value = "+" + value;
    }
    e.target.value = value.substring(0, 16);
  }

  function handleSubmit(e) {
    e.preventDefault();

    const message = form.message.value.trim();

      alert("Please fill in all required fields.");
      return;

Steps, required env vars, SQL table, server API code (Next.js pages/api/contact.js) aur client-side submit update ‚Äî sab niche diya hai. Copy-paste karke chalana easy hoga.

2) .env.local (example)

# Supabase (server-side) ‚Äî **SERVICE ROLE KEY** chahiye agar RLS on hai (secure)

NOTE: Agar tum SendGrid/SES etc. use karte ho, unka SMTP credential yahi dalein. Agar tum Sirf Supabase transactional email chahte ho, wo thoda alag setup hota ‚Äî bata dena agar woh chahiye.

3) Supabase table SQL
Supabase SQL editor me run karo (ya psql). Table name: contacts (example):

create table public.contacts (
  id bigint generated by default as identity primary key,
  name text not null,
  email text not null,
  phone text,
  subject text not null,
  message text not null,
  created_at timestamptz default now()
);
Agar Row Level Security (RLS) enabled hai, do ya to allow inserts from service role only (we will use service role key on server), ya create a function with policy. Using service role keeps server-side insert simple.

4) Server API: pages/api/contact.js
Create file pages/api/contact.js with this code:

// pages/api/contact.js
import { createClient } from "@supabase/supabase-js";
import nodemailer from "nodemailer";

const SUPABASE_URL = process.env.SUPABASE_URL;
const SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY = process.env.SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY;
const NOTIFY_EMAIL = process.env.NOTIFY_EMAIL || "hello@soarix.in";

// nodemailer config ‚Äî using SMTP
const transporter = nodemailer.createTransport({
  host: process.env.SMTP_HOST,
  port: process.env.SMTP_PORT ? parseInt(process.env.SMTP_PORT) : 587,
  secure: process.env.SMTP_PORT === "465", // true for 465, false for other ports
  auth: {
    user: process.env.SMTP_USER,
    pass: process.env.SMTP_PASS,
  },
  // ignoreTLS / tls options can be added if needed
});

// init supabase (server/service role)
const supabase = createClient(SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY, {
  auth: { persistSession: false },
});

export default async function handler(req, res) {
  if (req.method !== "POST") {
    res.setHeader("Allow", "POST");
    return res.status(405).json({ error: "Method not allowed" });
  }

  try {
    const { name, email, phone, subject, message } = req.body ?? {};

    // basic validation
    if (!name || !email || !subject || !message) {
      return res.status(400).json({ error: "Missing required fields" });
    }

    // 1) Insert into supabase
    const { data, error: insertError } = await supabase
      .from("contacts")
      .insert([{ name, email, phone: phone || null, subject, message }])
      .select()
      .single();

    if (insertError) {
      console.error("Supabase insert error:", insertError);
      // continue: we may still attempt to send email, but return error
      return res.status(500).json({ error: "Failed to save contact" });
    }

    // 2) Send notification email to site owner
    const mailHtml = `
      <h3>New contact from website</h3>
      <p><strong>Name:</strong> ${escapeHtml(name)}</p>
      <p><strong>Email:</strong> ${escapeHtml(email)}</p>
      <p><strong>Phone:</strong> ${escapeHtml(phone || "-")}</p>
      <p><strong>Subject:</strong> ${escapeHtml(subject)}</p>
      <p><strong>Message:</strong><br/>${escapeHtml(message).replace(/\n/g, "<br/>")}</p>
      <hr/>
      <p>Inserted id: ${data?.id ?? "n/a"}</p>
    `;

    await transporter.sendMail({
      from: `"Soarix Website" <${process.env.SMTP_USER}>`,
      to: NOTIFY_EMAIL,
      subject: `New message: ${subject}`,
      text:
        `New message from ${name} (${email})\n\n${message}\n\nPhone: ${phone || "-"}`,
      html: mailHtml,
    });

    // success
    return res.status(200).json({ success: true, contact: data });
  } catch (err) {
    console.error("API contact error:", err);
    return res.status(500).json({ error: "Server error" });
  }
}

// small helper to avoid HTML injection in email
function escapeHtml(str) {
  if (!str) return "";
  return String(str)
    .replaceAll("&", "&amp;")
    .replaceAll("<", "&lt;")
    .replaceAll(">", "&gt;")
    .replaceAll('"', "&quot;");
}
Important:

SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY must be the service role key (server-only secret) ‚Äî do not expose to client. Put it in .env.local (not committed).

SMTP_* vars must be set to a working SMTP provider. If you prefer SendGrid API instead of SMTP, I can give that variant ‚Äî but SMTP + Nodemailer is universal.

5) Client: update your handleSubmit to POST to API
Replace your current submit logic with this (in your component):

async function handleSubmit(e) {
  e.preventDefault();
  if (!formData.name || !formData.email || !formData.subject || !formData.message) {
    alert('Please fill in all required fields.');
    return;
  }

  try {
    const resp = await fetch('/api/contact', {
      method: 'POST',
      headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' },
      body: JSON.stringify(formData),
    });

    const json = await resp.json();
    if (!resp.ok) {
      console.error("Submit error", json);
      alert('Something went wrong. Please try again later.');
      return;
    }

    alert('Thank you ‚Äî message sent!');
    setFormData({ name: '', email: '', phone: '', subject: '', message: '' });
  } catch (err) {
    console.error(err);
    alert('Network error. Try again.');
  }
}

Start dev server:

7) Troubleshooting tips
If insert fails: check SUPABASE_URL & SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY values and table name. Use supabase dashboard SQL editor to validate.

If email fails: check SMTP creds & port. For Gmail, you may need App Password or use SendGrid SMTP.

Rate-limits / abuse: add a simple server-side rate limit (IP-based) if needed.

  });
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false);
  const [successMsg, setSuccessMsg] = useState('');
  const [errorMsg, setErrorMsg] = useState('');

  const handleInputChange = (e) => {
    const { name, value } = e.target;
    setFormData(prev => ({ ...prev, [name]: value }));
  };

  const handlePhoneChange = (e) => {
    let value = e.target.value.replace(/\D/g, '');
    if (value && !value.startsWith('91')) value = '91' + value;
    if (value.length > 2) {
      value = '+' + value.substring(0, 2) + ' ' + value.substring(2, 7) + ' ' + value.substring(7, 12);
    } else if (value.length === 2) {
      value = '+' + value;
    }
    setFormData(prev => ({ ...prev, phone: value.substring(0, 16) }));
  };

  async function handleSubmit(e) {
    e.preventDefault();
    setSuccessMsg('');

    if (!formData.name || !formData.email || !formData.subject || !formData.message) {

      return;

        method: 'POST',

2) Server endpoint (pages/api/contact.js)
Create pages/api/contact.js (or app/api/contact/route.js if using app router ‚Äî tell me if you need that variant). This file will insert into Supabase and send you an email.

// pages/api/contact.js
import { createClient } from "@supabase/supabase-js";
import nodemailer from "nodemailer";

const SUPABASE_URL = process.env.SUPABASE_URL;
const SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY = process.env.SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY;
const NOTIFY_EMAIL = process.env.NOTIFY_EMAIL || "hello@soarix.in";

// init supabase server client (service role)
const supabase = createClient(SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY, { auth: { persistSession: false } });

// configure nodemailer (SMTP)
const transporter = nodemailer.createTransport({
  host: process.env.SMTP_HOST,
  port: process.env.SMTP_PORT ? parseInt(process.env.SMTP_PORT) : 587,
  secure: process.env.SMTP_PORT === "465",
  auth: {
    user: process.env.SMTP_USER,
    pass: process.env.SMTP_PASS
  }
});

export default async function handler(req, res) {
  if (req.method !== "POST") {
    res.setHeader("Allow", "POST");
    return res.status(405).json({ error: "Method not allowed" });
  }

  try {
    const { name, email, phone, subject, message } = req.body ?? {};

    if (!name || !email || !subject || !message) {
      return res.status(400).json({ error: "Missing required fields" });
    }

    // insert into supabase
    const { data, error: dbError } = await supabase
      .from("contacts")
      .insert([{ name, email, phone: phone || null, subject, message }])
      .select()
      .single();

    if (dbError) {
      console.error("Supabase insert error:", dbError);
      return res.status(500).json({ error: "Failed to save contact" });
    }

    // notify via email
    const html = `
      <h2>New contact from website</h2>

      <p><strong>Email:</strong> ${escapeHtml(email)}</p>
      <p><strong>Phone:</strong> ${escapeHtml(phone || "-")}</p>
      <p><strong>Subject:</strong> ${escapeHtml(subject)}</p>
      <p><strong>Message:</strong><br/>${escapeHtml(message).replace(/\n/g, "<br/>")}</p>
      <hr/>

    `;

    console.error("API error:", err);

// pages/api/contact.js
import { createClient } from "@supabase/supabase-js";
import nodemailer from "nodemailer";

const SUPABASE_URL = process.env.SUPABASE_URL;
const SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY = process.env.SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY;
const NOTIFY_EMAIL = process.env.NOTIFY_EMAIL || "hello@soarix.in";

if (!SUPABASE_URL || !SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY) {
  console.warn("Supabase env missing: check SUPABASE_URL & SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY in .env.local");
}

// init supabase (server-side)
const supabase = createClient(SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY, { auth: { persistSession: false } });

// nodemailer (may fail if creds incorrect)
const transporter = nodemailer.createTransport({
  host: process.env.SMTP_HOST,
  port: process.env.SMTP_PORT ? parseInt(process.env.SMTP_PORT) : 587,
  secure: process.env.SMTP_PORT === "465",
  auth: {
    user: process.env.SMTP_USER,
    pass: process.env.SMTP_PASS,
  },
});

export default async function handler(req, res) {
  if (req.method !== "POST") {
    res.setHeader("Allow", "POST");
    return res.status(405).json({ error: "Method not allowed" });
  }

  try {
    const body = req.body ?? {};
    console.log("API /api/contact received body:", body);

    const { name, email, phone, subject, message } = body;

    if (!name || !email || !subject || !message) {
      console.warn("Validation failed - missing fields:", { name, email, subject, message });
      return res.status(400).json({ error: "Missing required fields" });
    }

    // 1) insert into supabase
    const { data, error: dbError } = await supabase
      .from("contacts")
      .insert([{ name, email, phone: phone || null, subject, message }])
      .select()
      .single();

    if (dbError) {
      console.error("Supabase insert error:", dbError);
      return res.status(500).json({ error: "Failed to save contact", details: dbError.message || dbError });
    }

    console.log("Supabase insert succeeded, id:", data?.id);

    // 2) try sending email (but if it fails, we still return success; we log error)
    const mailHtml = `
      <h3>New contact</h3>
      <p><strong>Name:</strong> ${escapeHtml(name)}</p>
      <p><strong>Email:</strong> ${escapeHtml(email)}</p>
      <p><strong>Phone:</strong> ${escapeHtml(phone || "-")}</p>
      <p><strong>Subject:</strong> ${escapeHtml(subject)}</p>
      <p><strong>Message:</strong><br/>${escapeHtml(message).replace(/\n/g, "<br/>")}</p>
    `;

    try {
      if (!process.env.SMTP_HOST || !process.env.SMTP_USER || !process.env.SMTP_PASS) {
        console.warn("SMTP env missing; skipping email send");
      } else {
        const info = await transporter.sendMail({
          from: `"Soarix Website" <${process.env.SMTP_USER}>`,
          to: NOTIFY_EMAIL,
          subject: `New message: ${subject}`,
          text: `New message from ${name} (${email})\n\n${message}\n\nPhone: ${phone || "-"}`,
          html: mailHtml,
        });
        console.log("Email sent:", info && info.messageId ? info.messageId : info);
      }
    } catch (mailErr) {
      console.error("Mail send error (logged but not failing request):", mailErr);
      // we won't fail the whole request because DB succeeded
    }

    return res.status(200).json({ success: true, contact: data });
  } catch (err) {
    console.error("Unhandled API error:", err);
    return res.status(500).json({ error: "Server error", details: err.message || err });
  }
}

function escapeHtml(str) {
  if (!str) return "";
  return String(str)
    .replaceAll("&", "&amp;")
    .replaceAll("<", "&lt;")
    .replaceAll(">", "&gt;")
    .replaceAll('"', "&quot;");
}

// pages/api/contact.js
import { createClient } from "@supabase/supabase-js";
import nodemailer from "nodemailer";

const SUPABASE_URL = process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL;
const SUPABASE_ANON = process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY;

if (!SUPABASE_URL || !SUPABASE_ANON) {
  console.warn("Missing NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL or NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY in .env.local");
}

const supabase = createClient(SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_ANON);

export default async function handler(req, res) {
  if (req.method !== "POST") return res.status(405).json({ error: "Method not allowed" });

  try {
    const { name, email, phone, subject, message } = req.body ?? {};

    if (!name || !email || !subject || !message) {
      return res.status(400).json({ error: "Missing required fields" });
    }

    console.log("Attempting supabase insert:", { name, email, phone, subject });

    const { data, error } = await supabase
      .from("contacts")
      .insert([{ name, email, phone: phone || null, subject, message }])
      .select();

    if (error) {
      console.error("Supabase insert error (full):", error);
      // return detailed error to help debugging (remove in production)
      return res.status(500).json({ error: "Supabase insert failed", details: error });
    }

    console.log("Insert success:", data);

    // optional: send email (skip if you haven't set SMTP)
    try {
      if (process.env.SMTP_HOST && process.env.SMTP_USER && process.env.SMTP_PASS) {
        const transporter = nodemailer.createTransport({
          host: process.env.SMTP_HOST,
          port: parseInt(process.env.SMTP_PORT || "587"),
          secure: process.env.SMTP_PORT === "465",
          auth: { user: process.env.SMTP_USER, pass: process.env.SMTP_PASS },
        });

        await transporter.sendMail({
          from: process.env.SMTP_USER,
          to: process.env.EMAIL_TO || process.env.SMTP_USER,
          subject: `New contact: ${subject}`,
          text: `${name} <${email}>\n\n${message}\n\nPhone: ${phone || "-"}`,
        });
      } else {
        console.log("SMTP not configured - skipping email send");
      }
    } catch (mailErr) {
      console.error("Mail send failed:", mailErr);
    }

    return res.status(200).json({ success: true, data });
  } catch (err) {
    console.error("Unhandled API error:", err);
    return res.status(500).json({ error: "Server error", details: err.message || err.toString() });
  }
}

2) Quick workaround (recommended now) ‚Äî backend code thoda change karo
Agar column DB me hai lekin schema cache mismatch error aa raha hai, easiest & safe fix: remove .select() from the Supabase insert call in your API. Reason: .select() asks Supabase to return inserted rows using the cached schema; agar cache mismatch hai to error aata hai. Agar .select() hata doge, insert will still succeed but API will not request the returned rows (so no cache lookup).

Open pages/api/contact.js and change insert block from something like:

const { data, error } = await supabase
  .from('submissions')
  .insert([{ name, email, phone, subject, message }])
  .select();
to simply:

const { data, error } = await supabase
  .from('submissions')
  .insert([{ name, email, phone, subject, message }]);

// data may be null here - that's fine
if (error) {
  console.error('Supabase Insert Error:', error);
  return res.status(500).json({ error: error.message || error });
}

return res.status(200).json({ success: true });
Is change ke baad restart Next dev server (npm run dev) and form submit karke dekho. Agar DB insert success hua to problem solved temporarily.

// pages/api/contact.js
import { createClient } from '@supabase/supabase-js';
import nodemailer from 'nodemailer';

export default async function handler(req, res) {
  if (req.method !== 'POST') {
    return res.status(405).json({ error: 'Method not allowed' });
  }

  const { name, email, phone, subject, message } = req.body;

  // Simple validation
  if (!name || !email || !subject || !message) {
    return res.status(400).json({ error: 'Missing required fields' });
  }

  // Init Supabase client (frontend-safe anon key is fine here for inserts)
  const supabase = createClient(
    process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL,
    process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY
  );

  // Insert into Supabase
  try {
    const { error } = await supabase
      .from('submissions')
      .insert([
        {
          name,
          email,
          phone,
          subject,
          message,
          source: 'contact-form'
        }
      ]);

    if (error) {
      console.error('Supabase Insert Error:', error);
      return res.status(500).json({ error: 'Supabase insert failed', details: error.message });
    }
  } catch (err) {
    console.error('Unexpected Supabase Error:', err);
    return res.status(500).json({ error: 'Unexpected Supabase error' });
  }

  // Send Email via Nodemailer (optional)
  try {
    if (process.env.SMTP_USER && process.env.SMTP_PASS && process.env.EMAIL_TO) {
      let transporter = nodemailer.createTransport({
        host: process.env.SMTP_HOST,
        port: process.env.SMTP_PORT,
        secure: true,
        auth: {
          user: process.env.SMTP_USER,
          pass: process.env.SMTP_PASS,
        },
      });

      await transporter.sendMail({
        from: `"Soarix Contact Form" <${process.env.SMTP_USER}>`,
        to: process.env.EMAIL_TO,
        subject: `New Contact Form Submission - ${subject}`,
        text: `
        Name: ${name}
        Email: ${email}
        Phone: ${phone || 'N/A'}
        Subject: ${subject}
        Message: ${message}
        `,
        html: `
          <h2>New Contact Form Submission</h2>
          <p><strong>Name:</strong> ${name}</p>
          <p><strong>Email:</strong> ${email}</p>
          <p><strong>Phone:</strong> ${phone || 'N/A'}</p>
          <p><strong>Subject:</strong> ${subject}</p>
          <p><strong>Message:</strong> ${message}</p>
        `,
      });
    }
  } catch (err) {
    console.error('Email Send Error:', err);
    // Do not fail API if email fails, just log error
  }

  // Success response
  return res.status(200).json({ success: true, message: 'Form submitted successfully' });
}

import { useState, useRef, useEffect } from 'react';

export default function ContactPage() {
  const [formData, setFormData] = useState({
    name: '',
    email: '',
    phone: '',

import { createClient } from "@supabase/supabase-js";
import nodemailer from "nodemailer";

const supabase = createClient(
  process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL,
  process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY
);

export default async function handler(req, res) {
  if (req.method !== "POST") {
    return res.status(405).json({ error: "Method not allowed" });
  }

  const { name, email, phone, subject, message } = req.body;

  if (!name || !email || !subject || !message) {
    return res.status(400).json({ error: "Missing required fields" });
  }

  try {
    // Insert into Supabase
    const { data, error } = await supabase
      .from("submissions")
      .insert([{ name, email, phone, subject, message }]);

    if (error) {
      console.error("Supabase error:", error);
      return res.status(500).json({ error: "Supabase insert failed", details: error.message });
    }

    // Send email with nodemailer
    const transporter = nodemailer.createTransport({
      host: process.env.SMTP_HOST,
      port: Number(process.env.SMTP_PORT),
      secure: true,
      auth: {
        user: process.env.SMTP_USER,
        pass: process.env.SMTP_PASS, // Gmail App Password (NOT normal password)
      },
    });

    await transporter.sendMail({
      from: `"Soarix Contact Form" <${process.env.SMTP_USER}>`,
      to: process.env.EMAIL_TO,
      subject: `New Contact Form Submission - ${subject}`,
      html: `
        <h2>New Contact Form Submission</h2>
        <p><strong>Name:</strong> ${name}</p>
        <p><strong>Email:</strong> ${email}</p>
        <p><strong>Phone:</strong> ${phone || "Not provided"}</p>
        <p><strong>Subject:</strong> ${subject}</p>
        <p><strong>Message:</strong><br/>${message}</p>
      `,
    });

    return res.status(200).json({ message: "Submission saved & email sent successfully!" });
  } catch (err) {
    console.error("Handler error:", err);
    return res.status(500).json({ error: "Server error", details: err.message });
  }
}

// pages/api/contact.js
import { createClient } from "@supabase/supabase-js";
import nodemailer from "nodemailer";

const SUPABASE_URL = process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL;
const SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY = process.env.SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY || process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY;

// IMPORTANT: recommended to set SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY in your server env (Vercel) for secure inserts.
// If you intentionally want to use anon + RLS, you can put that anon key here.

const supabase = createClient(SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY);

/**
 * Helper to create a transporter that auto-detects secure flag based on port.
 * - port 465 => secure: true
 * - port 587 (or other) => secure: false (STARTTLS)
 */
function createTransporterFromEnv() {
  const host = process.env.SMTP_HOST;
  const port = Number(process.env.SMTP_PORT || 465);
  const user = process.env.SMTP_USER;
  const pass = process.env.SMTP_PASS;

  if (!host || !port || !user || !pass) {
    throw new Error("Missing SMTP configuration in environment variables.");
  }

  const secure = port === 465;

  // Transporter
  return nodemailer.createTransport({
    host,
    port,
    secure,
    auth: { user, pass },
    // If your host requires special TLS options you can add them here.
    // Avoid setting rejectUnauthorized:false in production.
  });
}

export default async function handler(req, res) {
  if (req.method !== "POST") {
    res.setHeader("Allow", "POST");
    return res.status(405).json({ error: "Method not allowed" });
  }

  const { name, email, phone = "", subject, message } = req.body || {};

  if (!name || !email || !subject || !message) {
    return res.status(400).json({ error: "Missing required fields" });
  }

  try {
    // 1) Insert into Supabase table `submissions`
    const insertPayload = {
      name,
      email,
      phone,
      subject,
      message,
      source: "website-contact"
    };

    const { data, error: insertError } = await supabase
      .from("submissions")
      .insert([insertPayload]);

    if (insertError) {
      console.error("Supabase insert error:", insertError);
      // Return 500 but still try to continue? we fail here to avoid lost submissions
      return res.status(500).json({ error: "Supabase insert failed", details: insertError.message });
    }

    // 2) Send email with Nodemailer
    const transporter = createTransporterFromEnv();

    const receiver = process.env.EMAIL_TO;
    if (!receiver) {
      console.warn("EMAIL_TO not set. Skipping email send.");
    } else {
      const html = `
        <h2>New contact form submission</h2>
        <p><strong>Name:</strong> ${name}</p>
        <p><strong>Email:</strong> ${email}</p>
        <p><strong>Phone:</strong> ${phone || "Not provided"}</p>
        <p><strong>Subject:</strong> ${subject}</p>
        <p><strong>Message:</strong><br/>${message.replace(/\n/g, "<br/>")}</p>
        <p><small>Inserted into submissions id: ${Array.isArray(data) && data[0]?.id ? data[0].id : "n/a"}</small></p>
      `;

      await transporter.sendMail({
        from: `"Soarix Contact" <${process.env.SMTP_USER}>`,
        to: receiver,
        subject: `New contact: ${subject} ‚Äî ${name}`,
        html,
      });
    }

    return res.status(200).json({ message: "ok", inserted: data });
  } catch (err) {
    console.error("API handler error:", err);
    return res.status(500).json({ error: "Server error", details: err.message });
  }
}
What this file does / why:

Inserts to submissions table.

Sends an email to EMAIL_TO via the SMTP settings.

Uses SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY where possible (more secure) ‚Äî if not present it falls back to anon key.

Auto-detects secure flag by SMTP_PORT (465 => secure true, 587 => secure false). This prevents the wrong version number SSL error you saw.

  };

    if (v && !v.startsWith('91')) v = '91' + v;
    if (v.length > 2) v = '+' + v.substring(0,2) + ' ' + v.substring(2,7) + ' ' + v.substring(7,12);
    else if (v.length === 2) v = '+' + v;

4) Common errors & fixes
supabaseUrl is required ‚Äî you didn't set NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL or it is undefined. Check .env.local and restart dev server.

SSL routines:ssl3_get_record:wrong version number ‚Äî mismatch SMTP_PORT and secure setting. Use 465 with secure true OR 587 with secure false. Code auto-detects based on port, so set SMTP_PORT correctly.

Could not find column 'subject' of 'submissions' in the schema cache ‚Äî your DB schema doesn't include a subject column. Make sure submissions table has all columns used (name, email, phone, subject, message). Alter table in Supabase SQL Editor if needed:

ALTER TABLE public.submissions
ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS name text,
ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS email text,
ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS phone text,
ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS subject text,
ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS message text,
ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS source text,
ADD COLUMN IF NOT EXISTS created_at timestamptz DEFAULT now();
relation "submissions" already exists ‚Äî ignore (means table exists).

column "phone" already exists ‚Äî ignore (means column exists).

'use client';

import { useState, useRef, useEffect } from 'react';

export default function ContactPage() {
  const [formData, setFormData] = useState({
    name: '',
    email: '',
    phone: '',
    subject: '',

    hp: '' // honeypot

  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false);
  const [successMsg, setSuccessMsg] = useState('');
  const [errorMsg, setErrorMsg] = useState('');
  const [cooldown, setCooldown] = useState(false);

  const errorRef = useRef(null);
  const nameRef = useRef(null);

  useEffect(() => {
    // focus name on mount
    nameRef.current?.focus();
  }, []);

  useEffect(() => {
    if (errorMsg && errorRef.current) {

    }
  }, [errorMsg]);

  // simple email regex (not perfect but ok for client-side)
  const emailIsValid = (email) =>
    /^[^\s@]+@[^\s@]+\.[^\s@]+$/.test(email);

  const handleInputChange = (e) => {
    const { name, value } = e.target;
    setFormData(prev => ({ ...prev, [name]: value }));
  };

  const handlePhoneChange = (e) => {
    let value = e.target.value.replace(/\D/g, '');
    if (value && !value.startsWith('91')) value = '91' + value;
    if (value.length > 2) {
      value = '+' + value.substring(0, 2) + ' ' + value.substring(2, 7) + ' ' + value.substring(7, 12);
    } else if (value.length === 2) {
      value = '+' + value;
    }
    setFormData(prev => ({ ...prev, phone: value.substring(0, 16) }));
  };

  async function handleSubmit(e) {
    e.preventDefault();
    setErrorMsg('');
    setSuccessMsg('');

    // honeypot check ‚Äî if filled, silently drop
    if (formData.hp && formData.hp.trim() !== '') {
      // pretend success to bots
      setSuccessMsg('Thank you! Your message has been sent.');
      return;
    }

    // client validation
    if (!formData.name?.trim() || !formData.email?.trim() || !formData.subject || !formData.message?.trim()) {
      setErrorMsg('Please fill in all required fields.');
      return;
    }
    if (!emailIsValid(formData.email)) {
      setErrorMsg('Please enter a valid email address.');
      return;
    }

    setLoading(true);
    try {
      const resp = await fetch('/api/contact', {
        method: 'POST',
        headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' },
        body: JSON.stringify({
          name: formData.name.trim(),
          email: formData.email.trim(),
          phone: formData.phone.trim(),
          subject: formData.subject,
          message: formData.message.trim()
        }),
      });

      const json = await resp.json().catch(() => ({}));

      if (!resp.ok) {
        // Show backend message if present. In dev show details.
        const backendMessage = json?.error || json?.message || 'Something went wrong. Please try again.';
        let showMsg = backendMessage;
        // Show extra details only in dev
        if (process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development' && json?.details) {
          showMsg +=  ‚Äî ${json.details};
        }
        setErrorMsg(showMsg);
        return;
      }

      setSuccessMsg('Thank you! Your message has been sent. We will get back to you soon.');
      setFormData({ name: '', email: '', phone: '', subject: '', message: '', hp: '' });

      // short cooldown to prevent immediate resubmit
      setCooldown(true);
      setTimeout(() => setCooldown(false), 3000);

      // auto-clear success after 6s
      setTimeout(() => setSuccessMsg(''), 6000);
    } catch (err) {
      console.error('Network / submit error:', err);
      setErrorMsg('Network error. Please check your connection and try again.');
    } finally {
      setLoading(false);
    }

The mail-send errors you were seeing are coming from the API (server) side ‚Äî either Supabase config / RLS or the SMTP/TLS settings for Nodemailer. Below I‚Äôm giving you a ready-to-paste pages/api/contact.js that:

// pages/api/contact.js
import { createClient } from '@supabase/supabase-js';
import nodemailer from 'nodemailer';

const SUPABASE_URL = process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL;
const SUPABASE_ANON = process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY;

const SMTP_HOST = process.env.SMTP_HOST;
const SMTP_PORT = process.env.SMTP_PORT ? Number(process.env.SMTP_PORT) : 587;
const SMTP_USER = process.env.SMTP_USER;
const SMTP_PASS = process.env.SMTP_PASS;
const EMAIL_TO = process.env.EMAIL_TO;
const FROM_NAME = process.env.FROM_NAME || 'Website';
const FROM_EMAIL = process.env.FROM_EMAIL || SMTP_USER || `no-reply@${new URL(SUPABASE_URL || 'https://example.com').hostname}`;

if (!SUPABASE_URL || !SUPABASE_ANON) {
  // Fail early in dev ‚Äî helpful message
  console.warn('Supabase URL or ANON key missing. Set NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL and NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY in .env.');
}

const supabase = createClient(SUPABASE_URL || '', SUPABASE_ANON || '');

function createTransporter() {
  // Choose secure based on port: 465 -> secure true; 587/25 -> secure false with STARTTLS
  const secure = SMTP_PORT === 465;
  const transporterOptions = {
    host: SMTP_HOST,
    port: SMTP_PORT,
    secure,
    auth: {
      user: SMTP_USER,
      pass: SMTP_PASS,
    },
    // do not reject on invalid certs by default; keep default behavior.
    // If you are on dev and see TLS issues, temporarily set `tls: { rejectUnauthorized: false }`
    // BUT DO NOT use that in production unless you understand the risk.
  };

  // For common compatibility, if not secure, enforce STARTTLS
  if (!secure) {
    transporterOptions.requireTLS = true;
  }

  return nodemailer.createTransport(transporterOptions);
}

export default async function handler(req, res) {
  if (req.method !== 'POST') {
    return res.status(405).json({ error: 'Method not allowed' });
  }

  const body = req.body || {};
  const { name, email, phone = '', subject = '', message = '' } = body;

  // Basic validation
  if (!name || !email || !message) {
    return res.status(400).json({ error: 'Missing required fields (name, email, message).' });
  }

  // Insert into Supabase `submissions` table.
  // Make sure your table exists and columns match: name, email, phone, subject, message, source
  try {
    const row = {
      name,
      email,
      phone,
      subject,
      message,
      source: 'website-contact',
    };

    const { data, error: insertError } = await supabase.from('submissions').insert([row]).select();

    if (insertError) {
      // return useful error for dev, but not leak too much in production
      const details = insertError.message || JSON.stringify(insertError);
      console.error('Supabase insert error:', insertError);
      return res.status(500).json({
        error: 'Supabase insert failed',
        ...(process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development' ? { details } : {}),
      });
    }

    // DATA inserted successfully (data is an array with the inserted row)
    // Now send notification email
    if (!SMTP_HOST || !SMTP_USER || !SMTP_PASS || !EMAIL_TO) {
      console.warn('SMTP or EMAIL_TO not configured ‚Äî skipping email send.');
      return res.status(200).json({ message: 'Submission saved (email skipped, SMTP not configured).' });
    }

    const transporter = createTransporter();

    // Verify transporter before sending (gives early diagnostics)
    let verificationError = null;
    try {
      await transporter.verify();
    } catch (verErr) {
      verificationError = verErr;
      console.error('SMTP verify error:', verErr && verErr.message ? verErr.message : verErr);
      // We'll still try to send but likely will error - return helpful message for dev.
    }

    // Build email body
    const inserted = Array.isArray(data) ? data[0] : data;
    const mailSubject = `[Soarix Contact] ${subject || 'New message'}`;
    const html = `
      <p>You have a new contact submission from your website:</p>
      <ul>
        <li><strong>Name:</strong> ${escapeHtml(name)}</li>
        <li><strong>Email:</strong> ${escapeHtml(email)}</li>
        <li><strong>Phone:</strong> ${escapeHtml(phone)}</li>
        <li><strong>Subject:</strong> ${escapeHtml(subject)}</li>
      </ul>
      <p><strong>Message:</strong></p>
      <div style="white-space:pre-wrap;border-left:4px solid #eee;padding-left:12px;color:#111">${escapeHtml(
        message
      )}</div>
      <hr/>
      <p>Stored in Supabase (id: ${inserted?.id ?? 'unknown'})</p>
    `;

    const mailOptions = {
      from: `"${FROM_NAME}" <${FROM_EMAIL}>`,
      to: EMAIL_TO,
      subject: mailSubject,
      text: stripHtml(html),
      html,
    };

    try {
      const info = await transporter.sendMail(mailOptions);
      // success
      return res.status(200).json({
        message: 'Submission saved and email sent.',
        mailInfo: process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development' ? info : undefined,
      });
    } catch (mailErr) {
      console.error('Mail send error:', mailErr && mailErr.message ? mailErr.message : mailErr);

      // return 200 (we saved data) but indicate mail failed
      return res.status(200).json({
        message: 'Submission saved but email failed to send.',
        error: 'Email sending failed',
        ...(process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development' ? { details: mailErr && mailErr.message ? mailErr.message : String(mailErr) } : {}),
      });
    }
  } catch (e) {
    console.error('Unexpected error in contact API:', e && e.message ? e.message : e);
    return res.status(500).json({
      error: 'Server error',
      ...(process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development' ? { details: e?.message || String(e) } : {}),
    });
  }
}

/* helper utilities */

function escapeHtml(str = '') {
  return String(str)
    .replace(/&/g, '&amp;')
    .replace(/"/g, '&quot;')
    .replace(/'/g, '&#39;')
    .replace(/</g, '&lt;')
    .replace(/>/g, '&gt;');
}

function stripHtml(html = '') {
  // quick plain text fallback
  return html.replace(/<[^>]+>/g, '');
}
Troubleshooting checklist (if email still fails)
SMTP port / TLS mismatch:

Use SMTP_PORT=587, secure=false (the code auto-handles this) and requireTLS=true. For Gmail use port 587 with an App Password (if account has 2FA).

If you used SMTP_PORT=465, set port to 465 ‚Äî the code will set secure=true.

Gmail specifics:

If using Gmail, create an App Password (recommended) and use that as SMTP_PASS.

If using a normal password without app-password and 2FA on, Gmail will refuse.

Firewall / Local network:

SSL routines:ssl3_get_record:wrong version number often means you tried to talk plain text to an SSL port or the remote host refused TLS handshake. Try switching port 587 (STARTTLS) if 465 fails.

Supabase RLS / Columns:

Make sure the submissions table has columns: name text, email text, phone text, subject text, message text, source text (and an id primary key).

If you had earlier Could not find 'subject' column errors, refresh the table schema or confirm column exists in the DB (and that you are inserting the correct fields).

Confirm the row-level policy allows INSERT for anonymous users if you use the ANON key.

Check logs & response:

In dev, the API returns details on error. Check the browser Console / Network response to see the details when NODE_ENV=development.

pages/contact.js :-'use client';

import { useState, useRef, useEffect } from 'react';
import Head from 'next/head';

export default function ContactPage() {
  const [formData, setFormData] = useState({
    name: '',
    email: '',
    phone: '',
    subject: '',
    message: '',
    hp: '' // honeypot
  });
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false);
  const [successMsg, setSuccessMsg] = useState('');
  const [errorMsg, setErrorMsg] = useState('');
  const [cooldown, setCooldown] = useState(false);

  const errorRef = useRef(null);
  const nameRef = useRef(null);

  useEffect(() => {
    // focus name on mount
    nameRef.current?.focus();
  }, []);

  useEffect(() => {
    if (errorMsg && errorRef.current) {
      errorRef.current.focus();
    }
  }, [errorMsg]);

  // simple email regex (not perfect but ok for client-side)
  const emailIsValid = (email) =>
    /^[^\s@]+@[^\s@]+\.[^\s@]+$/.test(email);

  const handleInputChange = (e) => {
    const { name, value } = e.target;
    setFormData(prev => ({ ...prev, [name]: value }));
  };

  const handlePhoneChange = (e) => {
    let value = e.target.value.replace(/\D/g, '');
    if (value && !value.startsWith('91')) value = '91' + value;
    if (value.length > 2) {
      value = '+' + value.substring(0, 2) + ' ' + value.substring(2, 7) + ' ' + value.substring(7, 12);
    } else if (value.length === 2) {
      value = '+' + value;
    }
    setFormData(prev => ({ ...prev, phone: value.substring(0, 16) }));
  };

  async function handleSubmit(e) {
    e.preventDefault();
    setErrorMsg('');
    setSuccessMsg('');

    // honeypot check ‚Äî if filled, silently drop
    if (formData.hp && formData.hp.trim() !== '') {
      // pretend success to bots
      setSuccessMsg('Thank you! Your message has been sent.');
      return;
    }

    // client validation
    if (!formData.name?.trim() || !formData.email?.trim() || !formData.subject || !formData.message?.trim()) {
      setErrorMsg('Please fill in all required fields.');
      return;
    }
    if (!emailIsValid(formData.email)) {
      setErrorMsg('Please enter a valid email address.');
      return;
    }

    setLoading(true);
    try {
      const resp = await fetch('/api/contact', {
        method: 'POST',
        headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' },
        body: JSON.stringify({
          name: formData.name.trim(),
          email: formData.email.trim(),
          phone: formData.phone.trim(),
          subject: formData.subject,
          message: formData.message.trim()
        }),
      });

      const json = await resp.json().catch(() => ({}));

      if (!resp.ok) {
        // Show backend message if present. In dev show details.
        const backendMessage = json?.error || json?.message || 'Something went wrong. Please try again.';
        let showMsg = backendMessage;
        // Show extra details only in dev
        if (process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development' && json?.details) {
          showMsg +=  ‚Äî ${json.details};
        }
        setErrorMsg(showMsg);
        return;
      }

      setSuccessMsg('Thank you! Your message has been sent. We will get back to you soon.');
      setFormData({ name: '', email: '', phone: '', subject: '', message: '', hp: '' });

      // short cooldown to prevent immediate resubmit
      setCooldown(true);
      setTimeout(() => setCooldown(false), 3000);

      // auto-clear success after 6s
      setTimeout(() => setSuccessMsg(''), 6000);
    } catch (err) {
      console.error('Network / submit error:', err);
      setErrorMsg('Network error. Please check your connection and try again.');
    } finally {
      setLoading(false);
    }
  }

  // SEO constants
  const SITE_URL = process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SITE_URL || "https://yourdomain.com";
  const PAGE_URL = SITE_URL + "/contact";
  const OG_IMAGE = SITE_URL + "/contact-og.jpg";

  /* ---- inline styles (kept mostly same as your design) ---- */
